segments.text: Welcome to this demonstration of circle properties.
Let's start by creating a circle with radius 2.
The center of a circle is the point from which all points on the circle are equidistant.
The radius is the distance from the center to any point on the circle.
The diameter is twice the radius and passes through the center.
The circumference of a circle equals pi times the diameter.
The area of a circle equals pi times the radius squared.
Understanding these properties is fundamental to mathematics.
